algorithm_technique: Fenwick Tree for range queries and updates, SortedList to maintain indices of breaks.
problem_summary_simple: Count alternating color groups of a specific size in a circular arrangement, supporting updates.
problem_summary_technical: Uses Fenwick Trees and SortedList to efficiently count alternating groups and handle point updates on a circular array.
time_complexity: O(n log n + q log n)
key_insights: The problem requires efficient querying of contiguous segments with alternating properties and handling updates.
Fenwick Trees are suitable for range sum queries and point updates, while SortedList helps manage the indices where color changes occur.
The circular nature of the array needs careful handling of indices and segment lengths.
